name: Fractal Viewer V2
headline: A standalone application that renders the Mandelbrot Set and Burning Ship fractals.
technicalPoints: Created a supersampling algorithm to enahnce image quality.
Developed a preview window to bypass render times, so the user can explore fractals more efficiently.
Minimal GUI created to allow user to select colour schemes and fractal types.

name: Collections
headline: A web app to help users manage their collections of physical things, like books, CDs, other collectables, and share them with others.
technicalPoints: Modeling data to allow for user customization while not being too specific nor too general.
Choosing a balance between storing certain data attributes or relying on querires to fetch specific information.

name: Website + Contact Manager
headline: My own website! Built to display a portfolio of projects and introduce myself to other people and employers.
technicalPoints: Contains contact page to allow direct contact with me via email.
Built a backend to facilitate SMTP of emails and keep mail under alloted quota.

name: Daemon
headline: A linux background process/daemon that acts as a personal assistant, managing emails, calendar dates, etc.
technicalPoints: Using LibCURL to make HTTP requests and parsing the JSON responses.
Developing interaction to facilitate notifcations and event management.

name: CUDA Fractal 2D
headline: A GPU accelerated version of the FractalViewerV2, with the goal of running in real time and eventually rendering 3D fractals also in real time.
technicalPoints: Writing CUDA kernels to run parallel tasks on the GPU that render fractals.
Intergrating CUDA and Opengl to render and draw fractals all on the GPU.

name: BF Interpreter
headline: An interpreter/compiler system for the "Brainfuck" programming language.
technicalPoints: Developing supports to directly run a program or run in a live interpreter.
Adding options to customize memory size, both number of cells and max bytes stored in those cells.
